Web Speech Synthesis


Voice: Chooses the voice that will read the text.
It would also be possible to choose a language instead,
however as of right now the amount of supported languages is fairly limited.
Volume: Indicates the volume the text will be read with.

The minimum value is 0.
The maximum value is 1.
The default value is 1.

These limits may differ, depending on the used voice.
Pitch: Indicates the pitch the text will be read with.
An Increment by 1 usually appears to be a half step.

The minimum value is 0.
The maximum value is 10.
The default value is 1.

These limits may differ, depending on the used voice.
Rate: Indicates the speed the text will be read with.

The minimum value is 0.
Which usually means half tempo.

The maximum value is 2.
Which usually means double tempo.

The default value is 1.
Not working? The Web Speech API is only supported by Chrome, Firefox and Edge as of right now.

Grab the latest version of one of these and try again.
Please also be aware of the fact that the specification is still in draft mode and the code utilized to fuel this pen may break with future updates. Share this message Click here to create a link that automatically reads your text.
